bill_title: make biennial salary increases for legislators consistent with annual increases for other state officials and employees.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to make biennial salary increases for legislators consistent with annual increases for other state officials and employees. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 2-4 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The salary of each member of the Legislature for each regular legislative session as provided by § 2-4-2 shall be adjusted biennially by the rate appropriated as the across-the-board increase to base salaries of state employees under the general appropriations bills for the past two fiscal years. The first adjustment for this salary shall be based on the salary in effect on July 1, 2007. The first adjustment shall take place on January 1, 2009. Adjustments after the first adjustment shall take place at the beginning of each new term of legislative office every two years after that date. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.038 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
